sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>dirt</radical> next to your <radical>village</radical> is where you <kanji>bury</kanji> the dead. People don't live forever, so every village has a patch of dirt specifically used for burying dead things.
meaningInfo: Imagine the village where you grew up. Can you see the dirt area where all your ancestors were buried?
readingMnemonic: You don't just <kanji>bury</kanji> dead relatives here. You also buried your dead pet <reading>u</reading>ni (<ja>う</ja>) in that dirt. You thought having an uni as a pet would be a good idea. Too bad uni need water to survive.
readingInfo: Imagine crying as you bury your pet uni. Your tears can't save it now. (Though it is a bit ironic, since it needed salt water.)
